subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] How do you handle abbreviations?
msgSnippet: ... Why should one not write {27.16.} and {27.2.22.} -- with periods as in Traditional English Orthography. FWIW one of my least favorite traits of Esperanto
messageBody:
On 7.4.2007 peter_r_guinness wrote:
> How do you folk here handle abbreviations? Do you write
> them in latin script or spell out the letters with
> quickscript? For example: 1)"eg" <-or-> "27+16+27"
> ;2)"IBM" <-or-> "31+2+27+28+22"

Why should one not write {27.16.} and {27.2.22.} -- with
periods as in Traditional English Orthography.

FWIW one of my least favorite traits of Esperanto is that
they 'spell out' the initialism _Usono_ for _Unuighintaj
Shtatoj de Nordameriko_ rather than writing U.S.N., which
would be read out identically. _Uson-_ in effect is a new
root word detached from its initialism origin, and it's
meaning becoming as opaque and arbitrary as any root like
_mond-_ 'world'. The question is whether that is how we want
to treat TEO initialisms in QS, , since that is how these
abbreviations are normally pronounced? Conceivably one could
write {28.6.} and {26.2.22.} since those are the initial
letters of _International Business Machines_ and _exempli
gratia_ as written out in QS, but that might be confusing
for most people literate in TEO, who may not be aware of the
expansion of such initialisms.

--

/BP 8^)
--
B.Philip Jonsson mailto:melrochX@... (delete X)
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
"Truth, Sir, is a cow which will give [skeptics] no more milk,
and so they are gone to milk the bull."
-- Sam. Johnson (no rel. ;)
